articleinfo.releaseinfo: This manual describes version 2.15.2 of Time Administration Tool.

legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the Time Administration Tool or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

abstract.para: The Time Administration Tool allows you to set the time, date and timezone of your system, as well as setting any time server to synchronise your local time server.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The Time Administration Tool allows you to set the time, date and timezone of your system, as well as setting any time server to synchronise your local time server.

sect1.title: Getting started
sect1.para: You can start Time Administration Tool in the following ways:

varlistentry.term: Context menu in the clock applet

sect1.para: When you start Time Administration Tool, you may be prompted for the administrator password. This is necessary because the changes done with this tool will affect the whole system.
After entering the administrator password, the time configuration window is displayed.

figure.title: Time Administration Tool main window, automatic configuration mode

textobject.phrase: Shows Time Administration Tool main window, automatic configuration mode.

figure.title: Time Administration Tool main window, manual configuration mode

textobject.phrase: Shows Time Administration Tool main window, manual configuration mode.

sect1.para: The Time Administration Tool main window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: Displays your current timezone; the button displays a map for selecting a timezone.
You will be able to choose from a list of Internet servers to keep your computer clock synchronised automatically.
You will be able to fully specify date and time by hand.
This will allow you to synchronise just once with the selected Internet servers.

sect2.title: To change your time or date
sect2.para: Just change the time spin buttons or the date in the calendar.

sect2.title: To change your time zone
sect2.para: Click on the Select time zone button and select the new location, alternatively you can also select the new location from the list below.

textobject.phrase: Shows Time Administration Tool map window.

sect2.title: To synchronise your local time server with internet time servers
sect2.para: If the tickbox is disabled, enable it, then click on the Select servers button and select a new server in the list.

textobject.phrase: Shows Time Administration Tool servers window.
